text: IV A very few days had passed after this adventure , when Harriet came one morning to Emma with a small parcel in her hand , and after sitting down and hesitating , thus began : " Miss Woodhouse -- if you are at leisure -- I have something that I should like to tell you -- a sort of confession to make -- and then , you know , it will be over .
text_tokenized: IV A very few days had passed after this adventure , when Harriet came one morning to Emma with a small parcel in her hand , and after sitting down and hesitating , thus began : " Miss Woodhouse -- if you are at leisure -- I have something that I should like to tell you -- a sort of confession to make -- and then , you know , it will be over .

text: Emma was a good deal surprized ; but begged her to speak .
text_tokenized: Emma was a good deal surprized ; but begged her to speak .

text: There was a seriousness in Harriet 's manner which prepared her , quite as much as her words , for something more than ordinary . "
text_tokenized: There was a seriousness in Harriet 's manner which prepared her , quite as much as her words , for something more than ordinary . "

text: It is my duty , and I am sure it is my wish , " she continued , " to have no reserves with you on this subject .
text_tokenized: It is my duty , and I am sure it is my wish , " she continued , " to have no reserves with you on this subject .

text: As I am happily quite an altered creature in _ one _ _ respect _ , it is very fit that you should have the satisfaction of knowing it .
text_tokenized: As I am happily quite an altered creature in _ one _ _ respect _ , it is very fit that you should have the satisfaction of knowing it .

text: I do not want to say more than is necessary -- I am too much ashamed of having given way as I have done , and I dare say you understand me .
text_tokenized: I do not want to say more than is necessary -- I am too much ashamed of having given way as I have done , and I dare say you understand me .

text: " Yes , " said Emma , " I hope I do . " " How I could so long a time be fancying myself ! . . . " cried Harriet , warmly . "
text_tokenized: " Yes , " said Emma , " I hope I do . " " How I could so long a time be fancying myself ! . . . " cried Harriet , warmly . "

text: It seems like madness !
text_tokenized: It seems like madness !

text: I can see nothing at all extraordinary in him now.--I do not care whether I meet him or not -- except that of the two I had rather not see him-- and indeed I would go any distance round to avoid him -- but I do not envy his wife in the least ; I neither admire her nor envy her , as I have done : she is very charming , I dare say , and all that , but I think her very ill - tempered and disagreeable -- I shall never forget her look

text: , I assure you , Miss Woodhouse , I wish her no evil.--No , let them be ever so happy together , it will not give me another moment 's pang : and to convince you that I have been speaking truth , I am now going to destroy --
text_tokenized: , I assure you , Miss Woodhouse , I wish her no evil.--No , let them be ever so happy together , it will not give me another moment 's pang : and to convince you that I have been speaking truth , I am now going to destroy --

text: what I ought to have destroyed long ago -- what I ought never to have kept-- I know that very well ( blushing as she spoke).--However , now I will destroy it all -- and it is my particular wish to do it in your presence , that you may see how rational I am grown . Can not you guess what this parcel holds ? " said she , with a conscious look .

text: Her curiosity was greatly excited .
text_tokenized: Her curiosity was greatly excited .

text: Harriet unfolded the parcel , and she looked on with impatience .
text_tokenized: Harriet unfolded the parcel , and she looked on with impatience .

text: Within abundance of silver paper was a pretty little Tunbridge - ware box , which Harriet opened : it was well lined with the softest cotton ; but , excepting the cotton , Emma saw only a small piece of court - plaister .
text_tokenized: Within abundance of silver paper was a pretty little Tunbridge - ware box , which Harriet opened : it was well lined with the softest cotton ; but , excepting the cotton , Emma saw only a small piece of court - plaister .

text: " Now , " said Harriet , " you _ must _ recollect . "
text_tokenized: " Now , " said Harriet , " you _ must _ recollect . "

text: " No , indeed I do not . "
text_tokenized: " No , indeed I do not . "

text: " Dear me ! I should not have thought it possible you could forget what passed in this very room about court - plaister , one of the very last times we ever met in it!--It was but a very few days before I had my sore throat -- just before Mr. and Mrs. John Knightley came-- I think the very evening.--Do not you remember his cutting his finger with your new penknife , and your recommending court - plaister?-- But , as you had none about you , and knew I had , you desired me to supply him ; and so I took mine out and cut him a piece ; but it was a great deal too large , and he cut it smaller , and kept playing some time with what was left , before he gave it back to me .
text_tokenized: " Dear me ! I should not have thought it possible you could forget what passed in this very room about court - plaister , one of the very last times we ever met in it!--It was but a very few days before I had my sore throat -- just before Mr. and Mrs. John Knightley came-- I think the very evening.--Do not you remember his cutting his finger with your new penknife , and your recommending court - plaister?-- But , as you had none about you , and knew I had , you desired me to supply him ; and so I took mine out and cut him a piece ; but it was a great deal too large , and he cut it smaller , and kept playing some time with what was left , before he gave it back to me .

text: And so then , in my nonsense , I could not help making a treasure of it-- so I put it by never to be used , and looked at it now and then as a great treat .
text_tokenized: And so then , in my nonsense , I could not help making a treasure of it-- so I put it by never to be used , and looked at it now and then as a great treat .

text: " My dearest Harriet ! " cried Emma , putting her hand before her face , and jumping up , " you make me more ashamed of myself than I can bear .
text_tokenized: " My dearest Harriet ! " cried Emma , putting her hand before her face , and jumping up , " you make me more ashamed of myself than I can bear .

text: Remember it ?
text_tokenized: Remember it ?

text: Aye , I remember it all now ; all , except your saving this relic -- I knew nothing of that till this moment -- but the cutting the finger , and my recommending court - plaister , and saying I had none about me!--Oh !

text: " And so you actually put this piece of court - plaister by for his sake ! " said Emma , recovering from her state of shame and feeling divided between wonder and amusement .
text_tokenized: " And so you actually put this piece of court - plaister by for his sake ! " said Emma , recovering from her state of shame and feeling divided between wonder and amusement .

text: But one morning -- I forget exactly the day -- but perhaps it was the Tuesday or Wednesday before _ that _ _ evening _ , he wanted to make a memorandum in his pocket - book ; it was about spruce - beer .
text_tokenized: But one morning -- I forget exactly the day -- but perhaps it was the Tuesday or Wednesday before _ that _ _ evening _ , he wanted to make a memorandum in his pocket - book ; it was about spruce - beer .

text: Mr. Knightley had been telling him something about brewing spruce - beer , and he wanted to put it down ;

text: but when he took out his pencil , there was so little lead that he soon cut it all away , and it would not do , so you lent him another , and this was left upon the table as good for nothing .

text: I must get rid of every thing.-- There it goes , and there is an end , thank Heaven ! of Mr. Elton . " " And when , " thought Emma , " will there be a beginning of Mr. Churchill ? " She had soon afterwards reason to believe that the beginning was already made , and could not but hope that the gipsy , though she had _ told _ no fortune , might be proved to have made Harriet's.--About a fortnight after the alarm , they came to a sufficient explanation , and quite undesignedly .

text: She merely said , in the course of some trivial chat , " Well , Harriet , whenever you marry I would advise you to do so and so"--and thought no more of it , till after a minute 's silence she heard Harriet say in a very serious tone , " I shall never marry . "

text: Emma then looked up , and immediately saw how it was ; and after a moment 's debate , as to whether it should pass unnoticed or not , replied , " Never marry!--This is a new resolution . "
text_tokenized: Emma then looked up , and immediately saw how it was ; and after a moment 's debate , as to whether it should pass unnoticed or not , replied , " Never marry!--This is a new resolution . "

text: " It is one that I shall never change , however . "

text: Your resolution , or rather your expectation of never marrying , results from an idea that the person whom you might prefer , would be too greatly your superior in situation to think of you . Is not it so ?

text: Miss Woodhouse , believe me I have not the presumption to suppose-- Indeed I am not so mad.--But it is a pleasure to me to admire him at a distance -- and to think of his infinite superiority to all the rest of the world , with the gratitude , wonder , and veneration , which are so proper , in me especially .

text: From perfect misery to perfect happiness ! "
text_tokenized: From perfect misery to perfect happiness ! "

text: " It is very natural .
text_tokenized: " It is very natural .

text: It is natural , and it is honourable.-- Yes , honourable , I think , to chuse so well and so gratefully.-- But that it will be a fortunate preference is more that I can promise .
text_tokenized: It is natural , and it is honourable.-- Yes , honourable , I think , to chuse so well and so gratefully.-- But that it will be a fortunate preference is more that I can promise .

text: I do not advise you to give way to it , Harriet .
text_tokenized: I do not advise you to give way to it , Harriet .

text: I do not by any means engage for its being returned .
text_tokenized: I do not by any means engage for its being returned .

text: Consider what you are about .

text: Perhaps it will be wisest in you to check your feelings while you can : at any rate do not let them carry you far , unless you are persuaded of his liking you . Be observant of him .
text_tokenized: Perhaps it will be wisest in you to check your feelings while you can : at any rate do not let them carry you far , unless you are persuaded of his liking you . Be observant of him .

text: Let his behaviour be the guide of your sensations .
text_tokenized: Let his behaviour be the guide of your sensations .

text: I give you this caution now , because I shall never speak to you again on the subject .
text_tokenized: I give you this caution now , because I shall never speak to you again on the subject .

text: I am determined against all interference .
text_tokenized: I am determined against all interference .

text: Henceforward I know nothing of the matter .

text: Let no name ever pass our lips . We were very wrong before ; we will be cautious now.--He is your superior , no doubt , and there do seem objections and obstacles of a very serious nature ; but yet , Harriet , more wonderful things have taken place , there have been matches of greater disparity .
text_tokenized: Let no name ever pass our lips . We were very wrong before ; we will be cautious now.--He is your superior , no doubt , and there do seem objections and obstacles of a very serious nature ; but yet , Harriet , more wonderful things have taken place , there have been matches of greater disparity .

text: But take care of yourself .
text_tokenized: But take care of yourself .

text: I would not have you too sanguine ; though , however it may end , be assured your raising your thoughts to _ him _ , is a mark of good taste which I shall always know how to value . " Harriet kissed her hand in silent and submissive gratitude .
